group_1.textCenter: Finally, today is the day of the ceremony!

group_1.textLeft: Yes, at long last the day for us to come together@has arrived.

group_1.textRight: Kuroda and Shirogane seem to be getting ready@as well.

group_1.textCenter: If I remember correctly, the venue is the observatory@parking lot halfway up the mountainside.

group_1.textLeft: I believe it's a prudent decision.
With fewer people around, we can better contain@the damage caused by a Witch.

group_1.textRight: Apparently, Nightlife Homeroom's show has@reserved the venue.
Though I'm not sure how much thought they've@put into it, hehe. ♪
Nevertheless, it is that show which binds us@together until the very end.

group_1.textLeft: The TV host mentioned that since we've been@covering the Magical Girl story until now,
they want us to stay with them until the end.

group_1.textRight: Thanks to them, the choir club members and the@Advocates were able to board a bus.
Is the Professor also here because of the show?

group_1.textLeft: Since I've appeared on air as an expert in the field,@they want me to be present.
However, I don't want to get tangled up in things,@so I'm going to take it easy and just walk there.
Besides, this situation has been profoundly@emotional for me as well.
I want to slowly savor the joy of this moment.

group_1.textRight: You didn't have to give up on finding a way to save@your daughter.
So, what was your reason for gathering the three@of us together here?

group_1.textLeft: ...Well, truth be told, I had given up on finding a@way to save Magical Girls.
I wanted to share the true reason with the@three of you.

group_1.textRight: Is it a different story from the history of Magical@Girls not being recognized?

group_1.textLeft: It goes deeper than that. It's about the "reason"@behind the lack of recognition.
You see, I believed that the reason the existence of@Magical Girls wasn't acknowledged by the world
was due to something in "the Universe".
Once again, so abrupt.

group_1.narration: "First of all, there's a clear reason why Magical Girls@become Witches: the energy generated during this@transition is vital for sustaining the universe."
"Kyubey forms contracts with Magical Girls@as a means to harvest their energy."

group_1.textLeft: That's news to me...

group_1.textRight: In the end, we are sustenance for the universe...

group_1.narration: "Ultimately, just as the human body is composed@of numerous individual cells, it might be better to@see ourselves as integral parts of the universe."

"Therein, Magical Girls play a crucial role in generating@the energy necessary for the universe to function.@In the analogy of the human body, they might be@similar to the mitochondria found within cells."

group_1.textRight: So you're saying that we're the ones who produce@the food, rather than being the food itself?

group_1.narration: "While it's essential for a Magical Girl to become a@Witch to produce that energy, wouldn't losing that@process be considered a sickness to the universe?"

group_1.textCenter: I have heard of diseases that cause a decline in@mitochondrial function...
But...if that's true for us, then the act of saving a@Magical Girl...

group_1.narration: "Exactly, it's like a rebellion against the universe.@In that sense, we become akin to "cancer"@to the universe."

group_1.textLeft: Based on what we've heard from the Professor@so far, could it be that the reason why stories
about Magical Girls vanish without a trace,@merging into myths and legends,
is because they pose an inconvenience to@the universe?

group_1.narration: "As I observe these outcomes,@I can't help but feel that efforts to promote Magical Girls@are always mysteriously twisted by a force that feels almost@like divine mischief, regardless of the outcome."

group_1.textRight: Is this what you meant by divine mischief...?

group_1.narration: "If the universe possesses immunity or a self-cleansing@mechanism, then we might unknowingly be under attack@by the universe itself."
"I felt as if I were being targeted by an indiscernible,@incomprehensible force.@It struck me as strange that despite this feeling, incidents@involving Magical Girls didn't attract attention."

group_1.textLeft: But this time, there was no occurrence of such@divine mischief...
That's why I'm so happy, so profoundly moved!
Rabi, Asahi, Sasha! The three of you have shattered@my hypothesis...!
So today, with this joy, I wanted to share with you@what I had been thinking.
It's hard for me to say, knowing that many@Magical Girls have been sacrificed...
However, it's profoundly empowering to overcome@the despair that once prompted resignation.
Light has begun to shine on a future where@Magical Girls can be saved.
I wanted to express my heartfelt gratitude to the@three of you who gave me hope!
Thank you...

group_1.textRight: No, it's thanks to the Professor that we were@inspired as well.
Now, all we have left to do is to unite with everyone@and bring this all to a close.
